alert.note: Alert for Cottle (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:10AM CDT until July 14 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Extreme northwestern portions of Cottle County, portions of southern Hall County, and northeastern Motley County. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. The West Texas Mesonet station in Northfield recorded 0.27 inches of rain in only 5 minutes. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible over the area. This additional rain and the continuation of very high rain rates will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northfield and Cee Vee.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
